page.title: 03Housing in Freshfield
page.content: Tower Grange, built in 1350 in Grange Lane, was the oldest house found in our survey. Restored in 1908, it is reputed to have the ghost of a priest, who died in a priest hole, possibly in Elizabethan times. The present price of building land is Â£28 per square metre. The average cost of a house currently available for purchase, is Â£54,000. Most of the housing consists of expensive owner-occupied detached or semi-detached properties, with a good proportion of bungalows. Many and varied building materials have been used in the area. The reigns of Victoria and George V saw notable growth in Freshfield but the largest expansion in building has been between 1953 and the present day.
